item.title: Appendix C - Estimation and test results
item.description: H estimation by Whittle and Wavelet estimators. Chi square statistics and stationarity tests

item.title: Temperature Data
item.description:
The goal of this section is to describe the data used in the Temperature Fluctuation paper and how these data are organized. All the data are available in the tempFGN repository, and their organization strongly depend from the aim of the analysis that we have carried out.

Since the goal of our work was to study the historical variations of temperature fluctuations, we needed long temperatures time series, possibly for several weather station. We found a great solution in the data collected by Sigmund H. Moen, co-author of the paper and creator of the web page www.rimfrost.no, where most of the records are freely available.

item.title: About
item.description:
About Vanlog

We are a senior AI product studio.
We help teams turn applied AI research into reliable, production-ready systems.

Why we exist

Bulding AI products is deceptively easy. Making them work in production, scale over time, and be trusted by users is not. We started Vanlog to bridge the gap between AI research, product design, and real-world constraints, data quality, evaluation, costs, and long-term maintenance.

Director


Hi, I’m Andrea Melloncelli.

item.title: About
item.description:
We are a senior AI product studio.
We help teams turn applied AI research into reliable, production-ready systems.

Why we exist

Bulding AI products is deceptively easy. Making them work in production, scale over time, and be trusted by users is not. We started Vanlog to bridge the gap between AI research, product design, and real-world constraints — data quality, evaluation, costs, and long-term maintenance.

How we work

  1. Understand the problem
    We start from the use case, not from the model. Constraints, users, risks, data availability.

item.title: Agent Discovery (1 hour)
item.description:
In 60 minutes, we turn your idea into a concrete, actionable plan.

What you get: You receive a one-page summary with:

  • Use case tailored to your context
  • Data sources and required integrations
  • Identified risks and constraints
  • Next steps for your MVP

Who is it for?

  • Companies and teams exploring AI agents for the first time
  • Product owners and innovation leads with a specific challenge
  • Anyone who wants to move from idea to action, fast

What do you need?

  • A real business problem or opportunity
  • 60 minutes of your time (remote session)
  • Openness to discuss data, processes, and goals

What do you get?

  • A clear, actionable use case
  • List of data sources and integration points
  • Key risks and how to address them
  • Concrete next steps for your MVP

Let’s get in touch!

item.title: Data Analysis and Reporting with Python
item.description:
Data Analysis and Reporting with Python

Description

This course is designed to introduce you to the world of data analysis and reporting with Python. The first approach with the data must be to read it, clean it, and understand its content. Finally, after a numerical and graphical analysis, communicate results through beautiful presentations and reports. This is exactly what this course is about.

item.title: Data Science with Python
item.description:
Data Science with Python

Description

This course is an introduction to Machine Learning and Optimization with Python. The course starts defining mathematical modelling and how it can be used in real business cases. Examples of supervised and unsupervised learning are provided with a presentation of the main methodologies to train performant models. Then the course completes the picture with a deep dive into time series analysis and optimization problems. The course is designed to be interactive and practical. The student will learn by doing, by solving real business problems.

item.title: Deep Learning and Generative Models
item.description:
Deep Learning and Generative Models

Description

This course is designed for professionals and researchers who want to understand and use Deep Learning and Generative Models to solve business problems. The course covers the main concepts of Deep Learning, the main libraries and frameworks, and how to create custom models for regression, classification, and generative models. The course is designed to be interactive and practical. The student will learn by doing, by solving real business problems.

item.title: Efficient Data Science
item.description:
Efficient Data Science

Description

This is a course designed to understand Data Science. It is an introduction to the topics of Data Science on a high level. The main point is to understand the process that starts with the business need and terminates with a solution. The course is designed to be interactive with the trainer. The student will learn with example from real business problems.

item.title: Introduction to Python
item.description:
Introduction to Python

Description

This course provides a practical introduction to programming with Python, focusing on the essential skills needed to start working with data, automation, and scripting. Students will learn the basics of Python syntax, data types, control structures, functions, and how to write and run Python scripts. The course emphasizes hands-on exercises and real-world examples to build confidence and fluency in Python programming.

item.title: Mastering Large Language Models with AI Agents
item.description:
Mastering Large Language Models with AI Agents

Description

Large Language Models (LLMs) are at the forefront of the current revolution in artificial intelligence, unlocking unprecedented opportunities in automation, human-machine interaction, and dynamic information retrieval. In a world where businesses and organizations increasingly demand tailored, efficient, and scalable solutions, the ability to build intelligent agents powered by LLMs is becoming indispensable.

item.title: Professional Project Management with Python
item.description:
Professional Project Management with Python

Description

This course is designed to introduce you to the world of professional project management with Python. Real life projects are complex and require a structured approach to be successful. This course will teach you how to organize your project, develop it in a team, version code and data at the same time, and keep it tidy and reproducible to go in production smoothly and produce value for the business. The course is designed to oil and optimize your current Data Science practices and team.
